newsitem.title: USA: USDA Feb 12 world grain highlights.
newsitem.headline: USDA Feb 12 world grain highlights.

text.p: Brazil will harvest 26.50 million tonnes of soybeans, and Argentina 13.50 million tonnes in 1996/97 -- both record highs, the U.S. Agriculture Department forecast in its monthly report on world crop data Wednesday.
Australia would reap 23.10 million tonnes of wheat.
USDA said China will import 4.0 million tonnes of wheat, 1.7 million soybeans, 2.1 million soymeal, and 1.55 million soyoil.

A month ago, USDA pegged the Brazil soybean crop at 26 million tonnes and Argentina's at 13 million. Australia wheat was estimated at 21.5 million tonnes. Bigger crops mean all three countries would export more, Australia up by 2.5 million.
China, a premiere factor in world trade, was forecast last month to import 4.0 million tonnes of wheat, 1.9 million tonnes of soybean meal and 1.5 million each of soybeans and soyoil.

World grain crops will total 1,846.63 million tonnes in 1996/97, up from last month's estimate of 1,840.59 million tonnes and above last year's 1,706.19 million. World wheat was pegged at 581.04 million tonnes, coarse grains at 888.34 million and rice at 377.26 million. World oilseeds were forecast at 257.25 million tonnes and cotton at 86.21 million bales.
